Weekly report for Tuesday, May 9, 2001

    Here is the managers report!

    I met with Pacheco Brothers to discuss the general appearance of the grounds. We discussed the reseeding by the South clubhouse and thinning out the tree cover above the South main entry. The banana trees are being trimmed down throughout the campus. They are doing great work.

    Spa Masters pressure checked the solar heating system and found a small leak which they repaired. The Solar heaters are now on and should be warming up the h20 in the next few days.

    The checks for the reroofing (104k) and insurance (52k) have been cashed leaving the operating account w/ 30k. I will be making a bank deposit today or tomorrow.

    There was a main drain overflow in building 7 and the unit on the 1st floor suffered damage. I had the carpet cleaners dispatched and they soaked up the mess and had to change the pad. Jonathan and I performed a walk through.

    We have two CD's maturing soon. Fireside financial on 7/7 and Western Financial on 7/8. I have a meeting with Fremont Bank on Friday.

    The electrician is coming on Friday to tour the campus and give us an overview of what needs to be repaired and how much. This includes the chandeliers, fountains and hps lamps.

    I have informed our janitorial service to pay attention to the call box entry cobwebs and the stairwells. Let me know how they are doing. I have them doing a strip and wax on one of the buildings so we can see what condition the floor is really in. Joseph is replacing lights throughout the campus and performing his regular duties.

    This is a partial list of whats going on, so if you want to know exact details....you know where to find me.

    Sincerely, Ld
